head.title: To the Trade Fabrics, and a Deal

hedline.hl1: To the Trade Fabrics, and a Deal

abstract.p: Brunschwig & Fils is offering thousands of yards of fabric to public from its warehouse in New York City; photo (S)

block.p: Brunschwig & Fils, known for traditional fabrics sold to the trade, will open its warehouse troves to the public April 23-27. Thousands of yards of fabric and pieces of furniture will be up to 70 percent off retail prices. Monkey Business, the striped fabric, far left, will be $10 a yard (it was $59); Spalliera, left, will be $40 a yard (it was $145). At the Metropolitan Pavilion, 110 West 19th Street; information: (800) 538-1880.
